attributes.action: Require online Parliamentary petitions to count any votes against a proposal
attributes.background: Online Parliamentary petitions are created frequently.  At present, only those people who support a proposal can register their views.  Those who disagree with proposals should be able to register a negative vote which counts against the total requiring a Government response or Parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Allow family members of British Citizens in war zones or camps entry to the UK.
attributes.background: British Citizens are living in camps like Calais & Dunkirk waiting for family members to be granted leave to enter. I'd hope that the government would protect my family in crisis. We do not leave a friend of a friend on the doorstep in the rain. Get families of british citizens out of the camps.
attributes.additional_details:
Further links to Guardian article on this issue: 
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/31/migrants-dunkirk-british-citizens-france-tent-city-iraqi-kurds-uk-passports

attributes.action: Make the DBS filtering system fairer for people with more than 2 convictions.
attributes.background:
People that commit more than one petty offence have to declare this to some employers on application even though their offences may be petty or recorded decades ago.
With prisoners being released early and people getting a slapped wrist for serious offences today, historical offenders stand to lose
attributes.additional_details:
Since being made redundant, my friend has been unable to get another job because 35 years ago, he took a hub cap off a dumped car and on another occasion altered a road tax disk. Employers are unlikely to offer him a job because of it. In fact, a criminal with one serious offence that has lapsed can have his/her record filtered after a period of time.
I think petty recorded crimes recorded over decades ago should be filtered also. The current system is ridiculous and discriminatory.

attributes.action: Lower the age to buy cigarettes to 16.
attributes.background: Why do i have the option to fight for my country before i can buy a pack of fags its just stupid like a understand not lowering the drinking age but no ones going to smoke ten snout n get mwi off cigspin n start fighting at the weekend.

attributes.action: Grant a referendum on UK nuclear deterrent, - too important for mere Politicians
attributes.background: A UK referendum should dictate whether independent nuclear deterrent is maintained or upgraded, - too vital an issue for mere Politicians, - if a referendum on the less important EU matter is appropriate, so should survival of Humankind. Denial means MPs decide to protect UK population from itself?

attributes.action: Allow 'Calais migrants' to enter the UK for the Queen's 90th birthday.
attributes.background: We are being encouraged to have street/village tea parties to celebrate the Queen's birthday. I think something more tangible,useful and humanitarian such as allowing Calais migrants entry to the UK would be a more fitting tribute.

attributes.action: Change the start date of BST to the last Sunday in February ..
attributes.background: BST starts far too late and should start a month earlier. It understandable that we need winter savings but there in sufficient morning light at the beginning of March and summer time should start earlier.

attributes.action: Provide free basic television and radio for patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Currently many patients are charged for television whilst in hospital and for many patients it is costly.  Free radio and television would stop the burden of the cost and the complexity of setting it up.

attributes.action: Pass an Act of Parliament guaranteeing the asylum of Julian Assange.
attributes.background: Julian Assagne has had to seek refugee in the Ecuadorian embassy in London. Now that the UN has said that Assange has been declared to be in arbitrary detention. I call on the UK government and MP's to pass an Act of Parliament to protect him from deportation and thus grant him asylum in the UK.

attributes.action: Government must disclose all details regarding googles tax arrangement
attributes.background: Google PLC are known as "The largest company in the world". Due to vast profits partially generated in the UK. (10% - Ref 1).  It is said that those with the broadest shoulders should be bearing the strain but the google tax deal reveals how hollow those words are.  The deal should be exposed!
attributes.additional_details: Ref 1. http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1288776/000128877615000023/goog10-qq12015.htm - This would make 10% of profits from the UK equal to 5.2 BILLION in profits in 2015.  Attracting a tax liability of 1.04 BILLION for 2015 alone.  However the deal of £130 MILLION for 10 years is just another in a long line of large corporations avoiding their responsibilities.

attributes.action: Stop using Private finance initiatives for investment into public services
attributes.background: Private finance initiatives are inherently poor value for money schemes which use private investment to fund public work but in the long run cost government and allow private firms to profit from tax payer money. Therefore government should move from this short termism culture to reduce the deficit.

attributes.action: Radically overhaul the current frustrating and upsetting 111 phone system.
attributes.background: Employ adequately trained medically qualified call operators that are able to assess, understand and provide vulnerable and ill callers seeking medical advice with an appropriate level of service and advice of where to obtain the relevant care they require.

attributes.action: Provide funding for students' public transport costs
attributes.background: There are financially deprived students who are discouraged from attending University. A number of students use public transport as a means of getting to University. There are some students who board trains with invalid tickets due to little or no money. Public transport is a heavy financial strain.

attributes.action: Regulate imports of clothing from unethical sources.
attributes.background: Thousands of workers in countries such as India are being exploited and being payed close to nothing for their hard work. Their work places are unsafe as shown by the Rana Plaza collapse. We want our government to help stop this and make sure garments coming in to our country are properly sourced.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Savar_building_collapse

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit in the outside lane of a motorway for easier overtaking.
attributes.background: The 70 mile per hour speed limit was introduced back in 1965 and since that time cars have become much safer due to shorter stopping distances and more rigorous safety standards for car manufacturers. Roads have not advanced at the same pace however and are stuck using an outdated speed limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Cars today are also fitted with advanced technologies such as ABS and automatic braking. They have become safer but the roads have not grown to accommodate them. 
It should not be assumed that all vehicles have the same stopping distance and often cars that can achieve higher speeds have better stopping distances. For example a McLaren P1 (sporty car but still a good example) can stop in 30.2 metres while the Highway Code states it should take 102 metres to stop from the same speed.

attributes.action: lift the motorcycle restriction law.
attributes.background: lift the motorcycle restriction law and allow learners and full license holders with a valid cbt to drive any size bike at any age and not have the motorcycle restricted to a certain speed.

attributes.action: Making It illegal for motorcycles to filter on roads
attributes.background: When a motorcycle filters on a road they are making there own lane and putting themselves and others at risk and the Highway Code states pick a lane and stay in it this should of been a law years ago
attributes.additional_details: Some bikes slow down when filtering but most don't and when they hit a car as they did mine and my insurance pays them out you get to thinking how's that right I'm not allowed to filter in a car, van or lorry so why are motorcycles

attributes.action: Require retailers to offer a unconditional refund within 30 days on all items.
attributes.background: I got a faulty item from a fashion store but when I wanted to return the item the next day, they refused to give me a refund on the grounds that they don't do refunds. They even threatened to call the police on me. Consumers need more protection from the law to avoid bad service and unfair trade.
attributes.additional_details: Many retailers offer consumers unconditional returns within a period of time including on sale items. Some retailers like Gerard Darel, however, don't offer refunds in any case. Consumers drive the economy and we deserve a better protection from the government. The UK law should require all the retailers to offer consumers unconditional full refunds within 30 days from the purchase date on all items, as long as the item is in original condition.

attributes.action: Introduce education about the prison system & uk law within secondary education
attributes.background: Adolescents require increased education around the criminal justice system, and a chance to experience through education just what imprisonment can be like first hand, and as a deterrent from offending. Through hearing personal stories from inmates, prison officers and other professionals.
attributes.additional_details:
The government needs to start being pro-active as opposed to reactive when it comes down to teenagers and crime. 

In america this idea is used and has been found to reduce the risk of teens offending and living a life of crime.

"A program in the eastern United States invites young people into a prison to try to scare them away from prison. The goal is to teach them to avoid bad choices and bad influences that could put them behind bars for life" (learningenglish.voanews.com)

attributes.action: Build more affordable social houses, housing associations houses.
attributes.background: People like me can't afford to buy there own house and I have been on property pool for over 3 year's because there's a shortage of affordable social housing by housing associations. Not houses that no one can afford to buy.
attributes.additional_details: Out of every 600 houses getting  built there are just two 4 bedroomed houses and this isn't enough. Most of the houses that where for social housing are now changing to afford houses that are for sale but 98% of British people can't afford to buy there own house so we need more affordable housing associations houses. They are getting these housing associations to build theses so called afford houses for sale instead of for people who are on the social housing list.

attributes.action: Give every child under 16 £1 every year towards savings.
attributes.background: Many young people in the UK come from disadvantaged backgrounds where their parents can't support them with saving for the future. Like me, I come from a poor family and they couldn't support me at a young age. Many young people just like me are having a hard time saving for the future.
attributes.additional_details: You can help us achieve our lifetime goals by signing this petition. Thank you.

attributes.action: Prohibit employers from passing fines onto minimum wage employees.
attributes.background: It should be illegal for an employer to pass costs incurred through minor mistakes during normal business activities onto their minimum wage employees. Doing so, effectively means the employee is being paid less than minimum wage for the work that they do.
attributes.additional_details:
Such costs usually arise through minor mistakes and more often than not, through lack of adequate training, a responsibility of the employer.

These costs are usually insignificant to the employer, but to someone earning the minimum wage, these costs are enormous.

attributes.action: Stop nuclear warheads being transported through or near residential areas.
attributes.background:
The UK’s nuclear warheads regularly travel in convoys between bomb factories around the UK, and the Royal Naval Armaments Depot at Coulport on Loch Long — passing near and through many residential areas.

The potential fallout of an accident along these routes would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
On 9th of January, CND campaigners who were following a nuclear convoy between the Burghfield bomb factory in Berkshire and the Royal Naval Armaments Depot at Coulport on Loch Long tracked the route taken by the convoy past Hamilton, and through Stirling, and Balloch — residential areas.

The ability for anti-nuclear campaigners to follow the convoy also shows the potential for terrorists to do the same.

Nuclear convoys have also been spotted driving through icy and snowy conditions.

attributes.action: End the use of forms to reporting ex-partners to the Home Office for deportation
attributes.background:
The current forms are unfit for purpose and unworkable:
1. They do not ask for contact details making it impossible to check claims or locate person reported.
2. They do not say where they should be sent.
3. They risk being used by abusers to threaten spouses putting vulnerable people at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office forms can be downloaded here-
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/inform-ukvi-of-a-relationship-breakdown-statement-and-consent-form

The Independent raises concerns here-
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/home-office-helping-abusive-partners-by-producing-forms-making-it-easier-to-threaten-spouses-with-a6802966.html

Further info by Professor Thom Brooks (Durham University)-
http://the-brooks-blog.blogspot.co.uk/2015/12/press-release-failed-relationships-with.html

attributes.action: Give the British people a referendum vote on The EU by July 2016
attributes.background:
Stop all the time wasting on the non reforms being put forward by David Cameron and help get us out of the mess that is the European Union 
Regain our sovereignty close our borders and look after our own people first

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour and lower the living costs.
attributes.background: I believe it's difficult to live on the current UK minimum wage, with the current living costs. If we raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour and reduce the current living costs this would improve health in the UK!

attributes.action: Abolish Hospital Car Parking Charges for Disabled People in England
attributes.background: Abolish Hospital Car Parking Charges for vehicles that are registred as Disabled vehicles and display the necessary permit to show this.
attributes.additional_details: Wales and Scotland already have Free Parking for all in their Hospital Car Parks! I am only asking for Disabled exemption to begin with!!!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use, in this the 100th anniversary of WW1 and 75 of WW2, I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves. The petition reads
attributes.additional_details: Such graves at New Southgate cemetery N London have already been overfilled for reuse and an associated memorial demolished

attributes.action: Lodge a complaint with the International Court of Justice against Denmark
attributes.background:
To the UK Government,
We request that the UK lodges a formal complaint with the International Court of Justice in The Hague against the Kingdom of Denmark for violating European community laws. Danish Naval vessels have assisted the hunting of small cetaceans around the Faroese coast.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 4 paragraph 3 of the Treaty of the European Union states that "The Member States have a duty of sincere cooperation and should refrain from any measure outside of EU legislation which could jeopardize the rules of the Union or its objectives".
Sea Shepherd can provide photographic and video evidence that Royal Danish Navy vessels have also assisted the Faroese police in intercepting and arresting Sea Shepherd volunteers (including from the UK) who were trying to uphold European law.

attributes.action: Accept & publish on website all Petitions associated with UK EU referendum
attributes.background:
Little debate in parliament regarding all the implications of the UK leaving EU prior 23 June 2016 Referendum

UK petition website should accept all submitted petitions regardless of whether assessor assumes similar to another petition. Exiting EU is highly complex all petitions require debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens should have been aware of positives & negatives of UK leaving EU prior voting

Petition assessor rejected "Agree in leaving the EU, negotiate continued Free Movement for All UK citizens."
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/157571
Petition rejected grounds claiming similar to another petition  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/135700

All EU referendum petitions need open debate. Simply rejecting petitions on assumption similar when issues highly complex is undemocratic.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: Urge the Governments in China, Vietnam & Asia to ban the Dog Meat Trade
attributes.background: I was physically sick when I saw a video on Facebook depicting the torturing to death of dogs for human consumption. The dogs are kept in horrific conditions & as sentient animals, feel the same emotions that we do. They are absolutely terrified. It is inhumane, barbaric & abhorrent & needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: The Yulin Dog Meat Festival & Asian Dog Meat Trade focuses on farming dogs for human consumption. Thousands of dogs are rammed into tiny cages, contorted & left to weaken. Dogs are happy animals & it is believed that their happiness & good health is passed onto those who eat them. The perpetrators think that torturing the dogs by blow torching & skinning them alive & battering their heads willl keep the meat tender. Videos & live Facebook appearances, notably by Ricky Gervais are ref points.

attributes.action: General elections after the UK referendum and after presentation of BREXIT plan
attributes.background: The referendum resultet in a small minority of just over 50% of voters to leave the EU. The political leadership is broken down, negativ economical effects have emerged already. The UK situation is historically unique and has long term effects for future generations. General elections are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: The economic, political and social future of the UK is uncertain for years. The referendum was not a vote for a Brexiteer government.  Brexiteers need to come up with a short, medium and long term plan and well thought through vision, present this to parliament and the population. The same applies for other parties. Immediately afterwards, the populations needs to have the right to choose which party they trust most with this challenging tasks ahead through their vote in general elections .

attributes.action: Vote under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act for a general election in 2018.
attributes.background: We will soon begin exit negotiations with the EU. It is essential that the British people be given a chance to vote on Brexit again, on an informed basis, once the terms of exit are known. In the referendum, we had to vote on the basis of contradictory predictions by the Leave and Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act, an election can only be held before May 2020 if a vote of No Confidence in the government is passed or if at least 434 MPs vote for an early election. The decision no longer rests with the Prime Minister.
The EU Article 50 process cannot, in theory, be stopped once it has begun. However, in political terms, if the UK elected a government committed to remaining in the EU, it is highly probable that the EU would find a way to secure its continued membership.

attributes.action: Work Permit For Athletes Easy Accepted Aslong As Team Provides Proof Of Contact!
attributes.background: If we do not grant athletes easy workpermits then the best football league in the world will suffer. This will mean the quality of the league will drop and tourists that come over to watch the games may find alternative leagues and teams too follow which will then effect local companies

attributes.action: Make Imperial Units legal for trade and mandatory alongside Metric Units.
attributes.background: Due to a change in Britain's EU status, make it legal to trade in Imperial Units again and also mandatory to have Imperial Units alongside any existing Metric Units.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of the British public would still prefer to use Imperial Units (Oz, Lbs, Inch, Foot, °F) but European Parliament made it illegal to trade in Imperial Units back in 2000. Due to a change in Great Britain's status in the EU many people would like the right to trade in Imperial Units and also have food packaging etc labelled in duel Units (Metric and Imperial) this is in the interests of everybody as many like to use Metric and many like to use Imperial

attributes.action: Second EU referendum if the UK fall into a recession.
attributes.background: Due to the dramatic drop in the value of GBP following the 'leave' party winning the 'Brexit' vote, It is highly likely that the UK will fall into a recession and face brutal austerity. Sign this petition to trigger a second vote to alleviate it's affect on our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The current Chancellor of the Exchequer has predicted this recession will leave households £4,300 worse of on average.

attributes.action: We do not want a Norwegian EEC paid membership trade deal, or a Swiss deal.
attributes.background:
In the recent EU in/out referendum, the majority of the UK voted to leave the european union and we do not want a Norwegian or Swiss deal which would defeat the leave vote and why we voted leave.
We do not want to be a paid member of the EEC single market trading zone.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Conservative ministers have been reported by the BBC, Boris Johnson in particular of desiring a Norwegian trade zone membership deal against the interests of Britain and the majority of British voters who voted to leave europe and the single market.

Staying in the single market will do the economic damage David Cameron was talking about, and it will prevent us taking back control of our borders, immigration, fishing limits and full law making powers therefore it is against public interest.

attributes.action: To strengthen Sections 28 to 32 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Anti-Racism)
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum has lead to incidents of racist abuse.
UK immigrants, residents, and foreign nationals would benefit from reassurance and the strengthening of protection at this time. The government have an opportunity to strengthen the sentencing powers in relation to racial crime.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to a heightened period of public concern, tension, and political unrest; the tenor and rhetoric of the 'Leave campaign' in relation to immigration may result in a perception and presumption that the public airing of racist comments are an acceptable expression of views.

Evidence of some racist incidents can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/sarah.leblanc.718/media_set?set=a.10101369198638985.223406919&type=3

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Make voting eligible to only those who have paid PAYE tax for 5 or more years
attributes.background: Due to the backlash from the EU referendum from individuals who have no interest in what happens to the ordinary citizen and big businesses who are only interested in lining their pockets, we wish there to restrictions where only those who have paid into the country may vote for it's future.

attributes.action: Make York a union with London to remain in the EU
attributes.background: York voted to remain in the EU by 58%. This is the historical capital of the North of England and was the second city until the industrial revolution. York can develop a second financial and political centre and should join London to stay in the EU.

attributes.action: Second EU referendum after a suggested "cool down" period of 2 months.
attributes.background: 23rd of June saw the United Kingdom EU referendum. Campaigning on both sides was not comprehensive enough for informed decisions to be made creating a failed democratic result with consequences only being realised after the1st referendum. A second, more informed, truthful referendum is required
attributes.additional_details: There have now been a number of revelations made by prominent Leave campaigners after the referendum has completed that what they said during the build up to the referendum was untrue. Democracy only functions when the populous has factually correct information in which to base their decisions - in the first referendum, this unfortunately was not the case. If a 2nd referendum is held and results are within 5% of each other, the decision should be given to the UK government to vote upon.

attributes.action: Make voting be required by law from the age of 16
attributes.background: Turnouts in elections/referendums can be low meaning there are people out there not represented by the governments we elect or by the choices made in referendums - make voting be required by law, where if you don't vote you are fined (unless exceptional circumstances) and lower the voting age to 16

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: The government should rerun the referendum on our membership of the EU.
attributes.background: The binary question of leave or remain should have a third choice: Remain as a member with reforms met within a specified deadline. If the deadline is not met then we leave.

attributes.action: Say No to a Norway style deal with the EU!
attributes.background:
A Government based think tank is considering negotiating a Norway Style deal with the EU!

This should not even be considered as it is a watered down version of our past liability with the EU and that is what we overwhelmingly voted to be rid of!
attributes.additional_details:
Norway STILL has free movement of immigrants from the EU. 

Our Commonwealth friends, the rest of the world and indeed Germany has already confirmed that they still want to trade with us, so we make our own deals with what suits us. For 43 years we have been trading with a strait jacket on, imposed on us by Europe in compliance with their many rules and regs that we have now voted to reject.


Please listen to the people that have asked for change and voted us out of the EU, do the right thing and look after the British people first and foremost for a change and help us to achieve our full potential, which is one of power and greatness.

If you agree, please sign the petition.
